meanings.definition: A contradiction between two beliefs or conclusions.
meanings.sent1: The antinome between his faith and his doubts troubled him deeply.
meanings.sent2: The antinome of her actions left everyone confused.
meanings.sent3: The antinome of eating ice cream for breakfast was both delightful and concerning.
meanings.sent4: Their relationship was like an antinome, full of love yet filled with constant disagreements.
meanings.sent5: The antinome of the situation was so clear, it was like a black and white painting.

meanings.definition: A pair of statements that cannot both be true.
meanings.sent1: The antinome of his claims made it hard to trust his words.
meanings.sent2: The antinome between what he said and what he did was evident to all.
meanings.sent3: The antinome of the weather forecast and the actual weather made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Their promises were like an antinome, beautiful but impossible to fulfill.
meanings.sent5: The antinome of their arguments echoed in the empty room, highlighting the impossibility of agreement.
